translation.text: He does whatever He pleases.

translation.text: O Nanak, through the Name, one is blessed with glorious greatness, and obtains honor in the Court of the True Lord. ||16||3||

text: ਜੋ ਆਇਆ ਸੋ ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਜਾਸੀ ॥

translation.text: All who come shall have to depart.

translation.text: Those humble beings who are protected by the True Guru, are saved. They merge into the Truest of the True. ||1||

translation.text: Thay alone are acceptable, upon whom He bestows His Glance of Grace.

transliteration.text: jis nō nadar karē sōī jan lēkhai .

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗਿਆਨੁ ਤਿਸੁ ਸਭੁ ਕਿਛੁ ਸੂਝੈ ਅਗਿਆਨੀ ਅੰਧੁ ਕਮਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh attains spiritual wisdom, and understands everything. The ignorant ones act blindly. ||2||

transliteration.text: guramukh giān tis sabh kish sūjhai agiānī andh kamāī hē .2.

translation.text: He dies and dies again, only to be reborn, and loses his life uselessly again.

translation.text: The Gurmukh is imbued with the Naam, the Name of the Lord; he find peace, and is intuitively immersed in the True Lord. ||3||

transliteration.text: guramukh nām ratē sukh pāiā sahajē sāch samāī hē .3.

translation.text: But meeting with the Perfect Guru, it is transmuted into gold once again.

transliteration.text: phir hōvai kanchan bhētai gur pūrā .

text: ਆਪੇ ਬਖਸਿ ਲਏ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਏ ਪੂਰੈ ਸਬਦਿ ਮਿਲਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: When the Lord Himself grants forgiveness, then peace is obtained; through the Perfect Word of the Shabad, one is united with Him. ||4||

transliteration.text: āpē bakhas laē sukh pāē pūrai sabad milāī hē .4.

text: ਕਚੀ ਮਤਿ ਫੀਕਾ ਮੁਖਿ ਬੋਲੈ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

text: ਪਿਰ ਕਾ ਸਾਉ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ ਮੂਰਖਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਗੁਰ ਬੂਝ ਨ ਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: The foolish person does not know the excellence of her Husband Lord. Without the Guru, she does not understand at all. ||6||

transliteration.text: pir kā sāu n jānai mūrakh bin gur būjh n pāī hē .6.

text: ਗੁਣਵੰਤੀ ਸਦਾ ਪਿਰੁ ਰਾਵੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰਿ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: Egotism attaches them to the juice of emotional attachment, and makes them run around.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: The Gurmukh is intuitively immersed in the True Love of the Lord.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਆਪੇ ਮੇਲੈ ਆਪੇ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਖੈ ਬਿਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਬੂਝ ਨ ਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੯॥

translation.text: He Himself unites, He Himself acts, and beholds. Without the True Guru, understanding is not obtained. ||9||

transliteration.text: āpē mēlai āpē kar vēkhai bin satigur būjh n pāī hē .9.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਇਕਿ ਸਬਦੁ ਵੀਚਾਰਿ ਸਦਾ ਜਨ ਜਾਗੇ ॥

translation.text: Some contemplate the Word of the Shabad; these humble beings remain always awake and aware.

transliteration.text: ik sabad vīchār sadā jan jāgē .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਇਕਿ ਮਾਇਆ ਮੋਹਿ ਸੋਇ ਰਹੇ ਅਭਾਗੇ ॥

translation.text: Some are attached to the love of Maya; these unfortunate ones remain asleep.

transliteration.text: ik māiā mōh sōi rahē abhāgē .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਆਪੇ ਕਰੇ ਕਰਾਏ ਆਪੇ ਹੋਰੁ ਕਰਣਾ ਕਿਛੂ ਨ ਜਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: He Himself acts, and inspires all to act; no one else can do anything. ||10||

transliteration.text: āpē karē karāē āpē hōr karanā kishū n jāī hē .10.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, death is conquered and killed.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਰਖੈ ਉਰ ਧਾਰੇ ॥

translation.text: Keep the Name of the Lord enshrined within your heart.

transliteration.text: har kā nām rakhai ur dhārē .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਤੇ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਹਰਿ ਕੈ ਨਾਮਿ ਸਮਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: Serving the True Guru, peace is obtained, and one merges in the Name of the Lord. ||11||

transliteration.text: satigur sēvā tē sukh pāiā har kai nām samāī hē .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: In the love of duality, the world wanders around insane.

translation.text: Immersed in love and attachment to Maya, it suffers in pain.

text: ਬਹੁਤੇ ਭੇਖ ਕਰੈ ਨਹ ਪਾਏ ਬਿਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੁਖੁ ਨ ਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: Wearing all sorts of religious robes, He is not obtained. Without the True Guru, peace is not found. ||12||

transliteration.text: bahutē bhēkh karai nah pāē bin satigur sukh n pāī hē .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਕਿਸ ਨੋ ਕਹੀਐ ਜਾ ਆਪਿ ਕਰਾਏ ॥

translation.text: Who is to blame, when He Himself does everything?

transliteration.text: kis nō kahīai jā āp karāē .

translation.text: As He wills, so is the path we take.

text: ਆਪੇ ਮਿਹਰਵਾਨੁ ਸੁਖਦਾਤਾ ਜਿਉ ਭਾਵੈ ਤਿਵੈ ਚਲਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: He Himself is the Merciful Giver of peace; as He wills, so do we follow. ||13||

transliteration.text: āpē miharavān sukhadātā jiu bhāvai tivai chalāī hē .13.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: He Himself is the Creator, and He Himself is the Enjoyer.

translation.text: He Himself is detached, and He Himself is attached.

text: ਆਪੇ ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਮਿਹਰਵਾਨੁ ਮਧੁਸੂਦਨੁ ਜਿਸ ਦਾ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਨ ਮੇਟਿਆ ਜਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: He Himself is immaculate, compassionate, the lover of nectar; the Hukam of His Command cannot be erased. ||14||

transliteration.text: āpē niramal miharavān madhusūdan jis dā hukam n mētiā jāī hē .14.
